captions.text: >>OH HEY! DO YOU GUYS WANT TO HAVE A PICNIC?
>>OH YEAH, I GOT SOME PLASTIC CUPS
WE CAN MAKE PB & J SANDWICHES.
AND I WILL BRING MY WINNING PERSONALITY. OKAY.
OH MAN, I HAVEN'T BEEN ON A PICNIC
>>UH, YEAH, BUT, UH, WHY ARE YOU PUTTING THE JELLY
ON TOP OF THE PEANUT BUTTER ON THE SAME PIECE OF BREAD?
I KNOW WHAT I'M TALKING ABOUT.
NO, YOU NEED TO USE EACH PIECE OF BREAD FOR EACH INGREDIENT.
>>I'M SORRY, IS MY INFERIOR WAY OF
SPREADING TWO INGREDIENTS ON A SANDWICH GOING TO RUIN THE
MOST BASIC MEAL OF ALL TIME?
>>SO, YOU ADMIT YOUR WAY IS INFERIOR.
THIS WAY YOU GET THE PERFECT PROPORTION
MATT WHAT ARE YOU DOING TO THAT SANDWICH?
>>YOU GOT TO PUT PEANUT BUTTER ON BOTH SLICES OF BREAD AND THEN
PUT THE JELLY IN THE MIDDLE.

THAT WAY THE BREAD DOESN'T GET ALL SOAKED
UP FROM THE JELLY!
>>OKAY, BUT THEN YOU WOULD TASTE NOTHING BUT PEANUT BUTTER.
HAVE YOU SEEN TOP CHEF JASON?
>>WHICH IS WHY YOU HAVE TO BALANCE BOTH INGREDIENTS
>>I GOT THE LEMON-- MATT, WHY DIDN'T YOU TOAST
>>DON'T RUIN THIS JUST LIKE YOU RUINED THANKSGIVING MATT!
>>OH, YOU HAD TO BRING THAT UP!
>>GUYS, EVERY SECOND WE WASTE IS ANOTHER BITE  OF PURPLE BREAD.
WHO MAKES INSTANT POTATOES ON THE MOST IMPORTANT
>>I GOOGLED IT. YOU HAVE TO PEEL 'EM, BOIL 'EM,
MASH 'EM, STICK 'EM IN A STEW. I'M NOT SAMWISE FLIPPING GAMGEE.

>>THAT'S WHY IT'S A FEAST ON ONE DAY OF THE
YEAR.
[LAUGHTER] GUYS, OH MAN, YOU GUYS ARE TOO MUCH  FUN

UM, I DON'T WANT TO BE THAT NOSY NEIGHBOR
OR ANYTHING,
BUT I COULDN'T HELP BUT OVERHEAR YOUR CONVERSATION
AND I THINK I CAN HELP.
HAVE YOU GUYS EVER HEARD OF SMUCKER'S GOOBER?
YEAH, IT'S GREAT BECAUSE THE PEANUT
BUTTER AND THE JELLY ARE IN THE SAME CONTAINER.
OH, UH, DON'T WORRY ABOUT IT.

title: How to Make the Best Peanut Butter and Jelly Sandwich - Studio C

comments.text:
Step one: Get exactly 2 slugs, one bagel and peas and nuts.
Step two: Cut the slugs in half and squeeze out the insides that way you 
have the "jelly".
Step three: A peanut is really just a pea and a nut together, so take some 
peas and nuts,  blend them together so you have a substance that's like 
butter. Hence the name "Pea nut butter"
Step four: You need bread so why not use a bagel?
Step five: Put everything together (It doesn't matter what order, The jelly 
can be on the outside and the bagel on the inside) and eat (If you dare).
Step six: Ask your self if you can trust my recipes again.﻿
comments.author: Elizabeth Reynoso

comments.author: Danie Turner

comments.text:
You can make a PB&J any old way, but it takes time (and possibly some 
effort and money) to make a really great tasting sandwich.   

Step 1: Toast bread until lightly golden brown (this works best if it is 
freshly frozen first) - I know that doesn't make too much sense, but think 
of fresh bread which has just been put into a largely open space in the 
freezer, or just toasted for less time. It doesn't matter too much what 
kind of toaster you use, so long as you use good bread and get it right 
(for the amount of time). I recommend California or French Sourdough bread. 
   

Step 2: Have all of your materials ready: Cascade, Smucker's Jam (or any 
other kind of jam with very little or no preservatives - organic, perhaps) 
- it works best if it is this way for the peanut butter and jam, or if both 
are homemade, and this works best not only for your health, but greatly 
improves taste as well. DO NOT BUY MIXES IF YOU WANT YOUR SANDWICH TO TASTE 
VERY GOOD. I recommend Mara Natha Crunchy peanut butter, or you could put 
fresh peanuts (and yes, there is a great deal of difference between fresh 
and greatly stale) - on top of creamy peanut butter, or make it homemade 
(just grind the peanuts up with a very small amount of oil and salt). 

Step 3: Mix your peanut butters before hand if desired (if you have two or 
more to mix) Same with the jelly (MIX SEPARATELY)

Step 4: Immediately after the bread is toasted to your desired state 
(lightly golden brown recommended), remove the hot toast, put it on a 
plate, and lightly butter both slices with soft butter (Trade Winds 
recommended). The oil separates the PB&J from the bread.

Step 5: Spread the desired amount of peanut butter on one slice, and 
roughly the same amount of jelly on the other.  


Presto! (well not quite so fast, but) we made a good sandwich.﻿
comments.author: Jonathan Stebbins (JStebbs)

Your perfect sandwich.﻿

comments.text:
HOW TO MAKE A PB&J
1.Get two slices of bread.
2.Get peanut butter and jelly.
3.Put the peanut butter on one piece of bread.
4.Put the jelly on the other piece of bread.
5.Put them together.
6.Put on a plate.
7.Slice it in halve diagonally.
8.EAT IT!!!﻿

I make my pb&j's by getting three pieces of bread, then I take one of them 
and put peanut butter on one side. Then I take another one and put jelly on 
one side of it. Then I put those together in a classic sand which. Then I 
put peanut butter on the other side of the bread that is facing up. Then I 
take the third piece of bread, put jelly on one side, and put it on top of 
the one with peanut butter facing up. Bam. That's how it's done son. That's 
how I ROLL.




✌️﻿

peanut butter and honey too. But with peanut butter and bananas, you put 
peanut butter on both slices with the banana in the middle.
